description: A stocky, medium-sized parrot with a brilliant blue head and neck, a green body, and red feathers under its tail. They have a distinctive bare white eye-ring.
temperament: Known for being exceptionally calm, quiet, and gentle. They are less demanding than many other parrots and make excellent, easy-going companions.
loudness: Low to moderate. Much quieter than Amazons or Macaws, making them very suitable for apartments.
loudness_icon: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="w-12 h-12 text-green-500" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="currentColor" aria-hidden="true" role="img" aria-label="Quiet"><title>Quiet</title><path d="M7 9v6h4l5 5V4l-5 5H7z"></path></svg>
vocalization: Generally not known for their talking ability, though some individuals may learn a few words. They make soft, wheezing sounds when frightened, which is normal for the species.
dietaryNeeds: A high-quality pelleted diet, supplemented with fresh vegetables and fruits. They are less prone to obesity than Amazons.
healthPointers: Generally healthy and hardy, with a lifespan of 25-40 years. Can be prone to aspergillosis and vitamin A deficiency.
housing: A medium-large cage with a minimum size of 24"W x 24"D x 36"H is appropriate. They enjoy toys but are not as destructive as other parrots.
